text: hello it's Steven from langmaster
learning system happy April Fool's Day
you all know about this day but do you
really know exactly where is and where
it comes from let me tell you there are
so many different stories about how the
first of April came to be celebrated as
April Fool's Day the most widespread
story has to do with a change to the
calendar in the year 1580 to ancient
cultures including those of the Romans
and Hindus celebrated New Year's Day on
or around April 1st that it closely
followed the vernal equinox on March
20th or March 21st in Rome Pope Gregory
the 13th introduced a new calendar the
Gregorian calendar this calendar started
the new year on the 1st of January
but back then the information took time
to spread because at the time news had
to travel from place to place by
messengers on horseback or on foot
obviously there was no internet or
phones back then so for a long time many
people didn't know about the change to
the calendar and many others who knew
about it refused to accept the new
calendar these people continued to
celebrate New Year's Day on the 1st of
April the people who had accepted the
new calendar now started making fun of
these non-believers they would leave
them to believe in things that did not
exist but even send them on fools
errands errands that did not exist
[Music]
run
another less popular explanation of the
origins of April Fool's Day was provided
by Joseph Baskin a professor of history
at Boston University he explained that
the practice began during the reign of
Constantine a group of court jesters
told the Roman Emperor that they could
do a better job of running the Empire
the Emperor found it interesting and
allowed a gesture in kuegel to be
emperor for one day Hugo passed an edict
calling for absurdity on that day and
the custom became an annual event
anyways nowadays we celebrate April
Fool's Day all over the world friends
siblings relatives and even parents
often play tricks on their loved ones on
April 1st most April Fool's jokes are in
good fun and not meant to harm anyone
there are some typical pranks like
Vaseline on the doorknob
